title: Kevin Jonas Tells Brother Nick He Was 'Way Too Intense' for Being 7 Years Old
description: Kevin Jonas tells brother Nick that he was "way too intense" for being seven years old during an appearance with Joe Jonas on 'Hot Ones Versus' on Tuesday, Aug. 12. The Jonas Brothers kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour on Sunday, Aug. 10 in New Jersey.
content:
Kevin Jonas thinks Nick Jonas needed to take a breath when he was a kid.

On the Tuesday, Aug. 12 episode of  featuring the Jonas Brothers , Kevin, 37, took aim at Nick, 32, for being "way too intense" as a child.

"The three of us have been together 24/7 since we were kids. What childhood habit of mine annoyed you the most when we lived together?" Nick asked Kevin during the first round of the hot wing eating challenge.

 Never miss a story — sign up for to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. 

"You're way too intense for being 7 years old," Kevin responded, to which Nick agreed.

"We went on a family vacation and you decided, 'No, I'm not going to go on this cruise with my family. I'm going to stay home and work on Broadway,' " the eldest JoBro continued, adding that it was "impressive."

 Joe Jonas said that the cruise was "the s---," reminiscing on winning a hula hooping contest and drinking countless Shirley Temples with Kevin.

As for missing out on the family vacation, Nick concluded, "I don't regret it at all."

The "Who I Am" singer acted on Broadway as a child , appearing in Annie Get Your Gun , Beauty and the Beast and Les Misérables. In 2012, Nick returned to the stage for How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying .

Most recently, Nick starred in  on Broadway alongside Adrienne Warren .

The Jonas Brothers kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour on Sunday, Aug. 10, at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, N.J.

The band will make stops in Virginia Beach, Syracuse, Boston, Dallas, San Francisco and other cities through August, September and October in North America. They conclude the tour in Uncasville, Conn., on Nov. 14.

Ahead of their tour's start date, Nick told PEOPLE about how their catalog had aged well since the band got its start 20 years ago.

"It's aged very well. It's one of those things where we've looked out and seen the fan base really evolve and change and there's sort of a generational aspect to it now when you think about it," he said in July. 

"The people that were our age back when we were teens touring and making music are our age now and they've grown up and they're bringing their kids to the shows, but their parents that brought them when they were in their youth still want to come."

 

 Joe also teased what fans can expect from attending their latest tour, speaking with PEOPLE in June.

"I think what fans can expect is that we are going to do what we can to give them the best show they can possibly enjoy every night. Really have a fun time on the road, enjoy the fact that we get to do this after all these years and just try to bring something different," he said.
summary: Kevin Jonas, Nick Jonas, and their brothers, on the episode of the Jonas Brothers, Kevin and Joe Jonas. Kevin accused Nick of being "way too intense" as a child, while Nick agreed, referring to a family vacation when he decided to stay home and work on Broadway. The Jonas Brothers are currently on their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour, which will include stops in Virginia Beach, Syracuse, Boston, Dallas, San Francisco, and other North America.
shortSummary: Kevin Jonas criticizes Nick Jonas for being too intense as a child, while discussing their current touring schedule and his Broadway career.

scraped_sources.text: Exes Demi Lovato and Joe Jonas Reunite for Camp Rock Performance as The Jonas Brothers Kick Off 20th Anniversary Tour The Jonas Brothers kicked off their JONAS20 tour with a show at the MetLife Stadium in New Jersey on Sunday, Aug. 10 By Becca Longmire Becca Longmire Becca Longmire is a digital news writer-reporter at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2024. Her work has previously appeared on ET Canada, Metro and the Mail Online. People Editorial Guidelines Published on August 11, 2025 06:14AM EDT 1 Comment Joe Jonas and Demi Lovato in 'Camp Rock'; pair on stage on Aug. 10, 2025. Credit : DISNEY CHANNEL; BACKGRID NEED TO KNOW On Sunday, Aug. 10, the Jonas brothers kicked off their JONAS20 tour at MetLife Stadium in their home state of New Jersey Demi Lovato surprisingly reunited with her former Camp Rock costars to perform several songs from their hit 2008 Disney movieLovato, 32, told the crowd it "might have been longer" than 10 years since she and Joe teamed up to perform "Gotta Find You" The Jonas Brothers took a trip down memory lane as they kicked off their 20th anniversary tour. On Sunday, Aug. 10, Kevin, 37, Joe, 35, and Nick, 32, had a huge surprise for fans as they performed the first of their JONAS20 shows at MetLife Stadium in their home state of New Jersey with a very special guest. The trio reflected on their 2008 hit Disney movie, Camp Rock, with Joe — who played pop star Shane Gray in the film — belting out the song "Gotta Find You" before he introduced his former costar Demi Lovato, 32, who played Mitchie Torres, to the stage. The pair, who played onscreen love interests as well as having a short-lived relationship in real life in 2010, sang the movie's hits, "This Is Me" and "Wouldn't Change a Thing" together. After singing "This Is Me," which the duo performs together toward the end of the Disney flick, Joe — who added lines from "Gotta Find You" into the song — told the crowd they hadn't performed the track for "almost 10 years," as Lovato insisted it "might have been longer." Kevin and Nick also starred in the movie as fellow Connect Three band members Jason and Nate, respectively, and the latter reflected on the audition process while introducing the tribute during the gig. Demi Lovato joins the Jonas Brothers for 'Camp Rock' performance. Demi Lovato/Instagram He recalled of bosses initially wanting Joe to star in the flick, "Joe got the job, and then somehow our dad figured it out to get me and Kevin to be involved in the movie too," adding, "I think it's time that we all walk down this memory lane to celebrate a little movie called Camp Rock." Our new app is here! Free, fun and full of exclusives. Scan to download now! Lovato's husband, Jordan "Jutes" Lutes, 34, was among those sharing snippets from the much-talked-about reunion on social media on Sunday. The singer shared a clip on his Instagram Stories showing his other half walking onto the stage to huge applause, writing, "Couldn't be more proud … I love u sooo much baby," while tagging Demi in the post. Joe and Demi also posted their excitement over the reunion, with the pair lip syncing to "Wouldn't Change a Thing" in an Instagram video, as well as lip syncing to fellow Disney star Debby Ryan's iconic “Sat Down with the President of Disney Channel” speech in another clip. Demi captioned the post, "For the history books @joejonas." The surprises didn't end there, as the brothers were later joined on stage by their parents Kevin Jonas Sr. and Denise Jonas, and younger brother Frankie, 24, as well as Kevin's wife, Danielle Jonas, and the couple's daughters Valentina, 8, and Alena, 11, as they sang the band's 2007 track "When You Look Me in the Eyes." The brothers recently discussed the 20th anniversary shows during an appearance on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon on Friday, Aug. 7. "There's so much music to play," Kevin said. "The setlist is hard to build, right? But at the same time it's so fun because we do get to take breaks and admire each other's work at the same time." Joe jokingly added, "And pee breaks mostly." Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Joe Jonas and Demi Lovato in 'Camp Rock'. DISNEY CHANNEL/JOHN MEDLAND Reflecting on the band's 20-year anniversary, Nick said that "it's hard to believe" — and "in a lot of ways, it feels like it flew by." When they were putting the show together, it felt "basically impossible to summarize a 20-year journey with music." "What we feel we've come to is something that really represents the journey we've been on and the songs that are relevant to us and those steps in our career in different moments," the "Close" singer continued. "We've got some amazing special guests lined up and I just can't wait." The tour comes after the release of the Jonas Brothers' latest studio album, Greetings from Your Hometown. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Music Pop Music

Joe Jonas and Kevin Jonas Support Brother Nick Jonas on Broadway as The Last Five Years with Adrienne Warren Debuts The revival of Jason Robert Brown's beloved musical officially opens on Sunday, April 6, for a strictly limited, 14-week-only engagement By Dave Quinn Dave Quinn Dave Quinn is the Deputy News Director at PEOPLE. He has been working at the brand since 2016, and is the author of the No. 1 New York Times best-selling book, Not All Diamonds and Rosé: The Inside Story of the Real Housewives from the People Who Lived It. People Editorial Guidelines Published on March 19, 2025 05:35AM EDT Leave a Comment Kevin Jonas, Nick Jonas, Adrienne Warren and Joe Jonas backstage at 'The Last Five Years' on Broadway. Credit : Andy Henderson Welcome back to Broadway, Nick Jonas and Adrienne Warren! The two stage actors returned to the boards on Tuesday, March 18, as director Whitney White's revival of The Last Five Years kicked off preview performances at the Hudson Theatre in New York City. And they had two special people cheering them on: Nick's brothers and bandmates, Joe Jonas and Kevin Jonas. Posing together for a photo on stage after the performance, the Jonas Brothers were all smiles as they surrounded Nick, 32, and Warren, 37, Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Prior to that, the pair made their first bows to a standing crowd of enthusiastic theatergoers. They then celebrated their debut with a congratulatory hand slap and a hug, according to video of the milestone shared on the show's official Instagram account. Nick and Warren were then joined by White, who welcomed three-time Tony Award winner Jason Robert Brown — the composer, lyricists and book writer of The Last Five Years — to the stage. It was a special moment for Brown; despite his musical first premiering in 2001, the production marks the first time the show has ever been on Broadway. "Giving a big cheers to him for the Broadway debut of The Last Five Years," White said, presenting Brown with flowers. Joe Jonas shares a photo from the audience of 'The Last Five Years' as he supports his brother Nick Jonas. Joe Jonas/Instagram Nick Jonas and Adrienne Warren Belt from Broadway's The Last Five Years in First Listen at Upcoming Revival (Exclusive) The Last Five Years follows the demise of a relationship between a rising novelist named Jamie (Nick) and a struggling actress named Cathy (Warren), across two different timelines. His perspective is told in chronological order from when the couple first got together, while hers is told in reverse, from the end of their marriage. "Putting the whole thing together has been an absolute joy," Nick said during a joint appearance with Warren on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon earlier this month. "We're having the best time." "He's such an incredible teammate and such a hard worker," Warren added of Nick. "He ups the ante every single day and I'm like, 'Wait a minute. I gotta step up!' " Adrienne Warren and Nick Jonas in 'The Last Five Years' on Broadway. Matthew Murphy The PEOPLE Puzzler crossword is here! How quickly can you solve it? Play now! Nick went on to call playing Jamie "a dream role," but admitted in a video on The Last Five Years' Instagram account that doing the show feels "very intense." "It’s natural to feel a little nervous, so I’m trying to step into this with real focus and confidence. But it’s a big show and it’s got a lot of fans over the world," he said. Adrienne Warren in 'The Last Five Years' on Broadway. Matthew Murphy Nick Jonas and Adrienne Warren Sing Bittersweet Duet About Love in New Music Video for Broadway's The Last Five Years That would be an understatement. In the years since The Last Five Years premiered — first at Chicago's Northlight Theatre in 2001, and then, in a 2002 New York City production starring Norbert Leo Butz and Sherie Rene Scott Off-Broadway at the Minetta Lane Theater — the piece has become a favorite among the musical-theater crowd. Much of that is thanks to the Off-Broadway cast recording, which helped songs from the show like "Nobody Needs to Know," "Still Hurting," "If I Didn't Believe in You" and "The Next Ten Minutes" become showtune staples. An Off-Broadway revival at New York City's Second Stage Theater came in 2013, with Adam Kantor and Betsy Wolfe in the roles of Jamie and Cathy. A year later, a movie adaptation was released starring Jeremy Jordan and Anna Kendrick. In 2016, a one-night-only concert of the musical was staged at New York City's Town Hall, led by Joshua Henry and Cynthia Erivo. That same year, a production of The Last Five Years opened in London led by Bridgerton and Wicked star Jonathan Bailey and Samantha Barks, a breakout star of the 2012 Les Misérables film. Nick Jonas in 'The Last Five Years' on Broadway. Matthew Murphy George Clooney, Denzel Washington, Sarah Snook and All the Celebrities Leading Broadway's Starriest Season Yet This revival of The Last Five Years officially opens on April 6. The limited-run production is currently set to play for just 14 weeks, through June 22. When the production was first announced back in June 2024, it came almost exactly 25 years to the date after Brown wrote the first song for The Last Five Years (June 15, 1999). "I have always believed that when the time was right, The Last Five Years would make its way to Broadway," he said in a statement at the time. As for Nick and Warren, their returns to Broadway are reason enough to celebrate. He was last in 2012's How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying, while she is a 2021 Tony Award winner for her portrayal of Tina Turner in Tina, based on the music icon's life. Tickets to The Last Five Years are now on sale. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Theater

Where Is the Camp Rock Cast Now? See Where the Stars of the 2008 Movie Musical Are Today On Aug. 10, the Jonas Brothers and Demi Lovato reunited for a special performance in New Jersey By Maya Pow Maya Pow Maya Pow is a senior video producer at PEOPLE, formerly serving as an associate platforms producer. People Editorial Guidelines and Samantha Stutsman Samantha Stutsman Samantha Stutsman is a writer and surveillance editor at PEOPLE. People Editorial Guidelines Published on August 11, 2025 12:40PM EDT Leave a Comment Nick Jonas, Joe Jonas, Demi Lavato and Kevin Jonas in 'Camp Rock.'. Credit : ALAN SACKS PRODUCTIONS/Alamy NEED TO KNOW Camp Rock premiered on June 20, 2008The Disney Channel movie starred Demi Lovato and the Jonas BrothersJoe Jonas and Lovato performed Camp Rock classics, including "This Is Me," at a Jonas Brothers concert in August 2025 The legacy of Camp Rock lives on, nearly two decades later. On Aug. 10, the Jonas Brothers brothers kicked off their 20th anniversary tour in New Jersey, where Demi Lovato joined them onstage for a mini Camp Rock reunion. Together, she and Joe Jonas sang "Gotta Find You," "This Is Me" and "Wouldn't Change a Thing." Joe told the crowd it had been "almost 10 years" since they sang "This Is Me," while Lovato insisted it "might have been longer." The two briefly dated in 2010, two years after playing love interests in Camp Rock. The movie musical, which premiered on June 20, 2008, followed Mitchie Torres (Lovato), a talented yet shy teenager, who gets the chance to attend the prestigious summer music camp, Camp Rock. While trying to fit in and hide her modest background, she befriends other campers and catches the attention of Shane Gray (Jonas), a famous pop star attending the camp to rediscover his passion for music. The cast members' careers have evolved since their time on the Disney Channel. Lovato has released nine studio albums, including REVAMPED, her first remix album with re-recorded rock versions of her songs like “La La Land” and “Don’t Forget.” Meanwhile, the Jonas Brothers went on hiatus and have since reunited, releasing three albums. Here's everything to know about what the Camp Rock cast has been up to since 2008. 01 of 08 Demi Lovato as Mitchie Torres Demi Lovato in Camp Rock and in 2023. Bob D'Amico/Disney Channel via Getty; Christopher Polk/Variety via Getty After Camp Rock, Lovato continued her acting career, starring in Princess Protection Program (2009) alongside Selena Gomez, voicing Smurfette in Smurfs: The Lost Village (2017) and taking a lead role in Eurovision Song Contest: The Story of Fire Saga (2020) with Will Ferrell and Rachel McAdams. She’s also been the subject of three autobiographical documentaries: Demi Lovato: Stay Strong, Demi Lovato: Simply Complicated and Demi Lovato: Dancing with the Devil. The docs outlined her struggles as a child actor growing up in New Mexico, her rise to pop stardom and her journey to recovery from substance abuse. Currently, Lovato is living out Torres’ dreams as a successful artist. She has released several albums — including Confident, Dancing with the Devil ... the Art of Starting Over and HOLY FVCK — and earned two Grammy nominations. Lovato is now married to Canadian musician Jutes. The couple wed in May 2025. 02 of 08 Joe Jonas as Shane Gray Joe Jonas in Camp Rock and in 2023. Bob D'Amico/Disney Channel via Getty; Stefanie Keenan/Getty Disney crafted Shane Gray’s character from his real-life teen pop star persona. Joe initially started gaining attention as one of the members of the Jonas Brothers alongside his brothers Nick and Kevin. The New Jersey-based band launched Joe and his brothers into the limelight, securing contracts with Columbia Records and Hollywood Records, creating six studio albums and embarking on 11 tours. In October 2011, Joe released his only solo album, Fastlife, a pop-rock album featuring collaborations with Chris Brown and Lil Wayne. After the band confirmed their split in October 2013, Joe formed a funk-pop group called DNCE and introduced their debut EP, Swaay, featuring the smash hit single “Cake by the Ocean.” He continued his musical career by serving as a judge on season 7 of The Voice Australia. He mentored Team Adam Levine in 2017 and Team Nick Jonas in 2020 on the U.S. version. Joe and his brothers starred in the documentaries Jonas Brothers: Chasing Happiness (2019) and Happiness Continues: A Jonas Brothers Concert Film (2020), which took fans through their rise from teen stardom, the band’s hiatus, the brothers’ feuds and reconciliations and their triumphant return to the stage as a band. Joe married Game of Thrones star Sophie Turner in 2019, with the couple later welcoming two daughters. Joe filed for divorce in September 2023. 03 of 08 Nick Jonas as Nate Gray Nick Jonas in Camp Rock and in 2023. Bob D'Amico/Disney Channel via Getty; Dimitrios Kambouris/Getty Following the release of the Camp Rock movies, the band’s youngest member, Nick Jonas, went on tour with his band, Nick Jonas & the Administration, and released their debut album. After the group split, Nick pursued his aspirations of becoming a solo artist. In 2014, he released a self-titled album with chart-topping songs like “Jealous” and “Chains.” He also joined Lovato’s Neon Lights Tour as the musical and creative director. A few years later, Nick released his third album, Last Year Was Complicated, with songs like “Close” and “Bacon” ft. Ty Dolla $ign. While making strides in his solo career, Nick simultaneously ventured into acting. He played a lead role in Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle (2017) and Jumanji: The Next Level (2019) alongside Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black and Kevin Hart. He also made cameos on Hawaii Five-O (2013-2015), starred in all three seasons of Kingdom (2014-2017) and was featured in five episodes of Scream Queens (2015). Nick married actress Priyanka Chopra in December 2018. On Jan. 15, 2022, the pair welcomed their daughter, Malti Marie, via surrogate. 04 of 08 Kevin Jonas as Jason Gray Kevin Jonas in Camp rock and in 2023. Bob D'Amico/Disney Channel via Getty; Gilbert Flores/Variety/Penske Media via Getty Kevin Jonas followed a different path after the band’s split and took a step away from the music industry. The eldest brother co-founded the social media marketing company The Blu Market and helped develop the restaurant database app Yood!. Additionally, he partnered with We Heart It, a video-sharing app. During the band’s hiatus, Kevin shifted his focus toward starting a family with his wife, Danielle. They got married in 2009 and welcomed their two daughters, Alena Rose and Valentina Angelina, in February 2014 and October 2016, respectively. Kevin and Danielle shared insights into their love story in Married to Jonas (2012), a reality documentary series on E! that ran for two seasons. He has also made cameos on The Real Housewives of New Jersey (2014), The Apprentice (2015) and The Voice (2020). 05 of 08 Alyson Stoner as Caitlyn Geller Alyson Stoner in Camp Rock and in 2022. Bob D'Amico/Disney Channel via Getty; Matt Winkelmeyer/Getty Alyson Stoner was a standout character in the Camp Rock movies, but they established themself prior to the Disney Channel film. The Ohio native’s acting career skyrocketed after playing Sarah Baker in both Cheaper by the Dozen movies and Max on The Suite Life of Zack & Cody (2005-2007). They have also voiced characters in Lilo and Stitch: The Series and Phineas and Ferb. Their impressive dancing skills and stage presence have been evident since playing Camille in three Step Up movies and breaking it down in Missy Elliot’s “Work It” and “Gossip Folks” music videos. In March 2018, Stoner publicly came out as queer in a Teen Vogue article, in which they discussed how using they/them pronouns impacted their career. Stoner has since launched a podcast called Dear Hollywood, where they discussed how their life and other child stars’ lives were impacted by early fame. Stoner also founded Movement Genius, a digital wellness platform company. The actor is set to release their memoir, Semi-Well-Adjusted Despite Literally Everything, in August 2025. 06 of 08 Meaghan Martin as Tess Tyler Meaghan Martin in Camp Rock and in 2023. Bob D'Amico/Disney Channel via Getty; Paul Redmond/WireImage In Camp Rock, Meaghan Martin played Tess Tyler, the lead antagonist who is “too cool” and dreams of following in the footsteps of her mother, T.J. Tyler. Martin also starred in Mean Girls 2 (2011) as Jo Mitchell and Bianca Stratford in ABC Family’s 10 Things I Hate About You (2009-2010). She also appeared on Melissa and Joey and Jessie. In 2023, the Las Vegas native voiced characters in video games including Ten Dates, Atomic Heart and Xenoblade Chronicles: Future Redeemed. Martin married British actor Oli Higginson in September 2016, per Instagram. 07 of 08 Jasmine Richards as Peggy Warburton Jasmine Richards in Camp Rock and in 2023. Bob D'Amico/Disney Channel via Getty; Jasmine Richards/Instagram Jasmine Richards began her acting career playing Margaret Browning-Levesque on Naturally, Sadie (2005-2007) and Skater Girl on Princess (2008). After Camp Rock, she voiced Maya in Redakai: Conquer the Kairu (2011-2012). While Peggy won the Final Jam and was destined to become a record-selling superstar, Richards prioritized starting a family off-screen. Richards married Mike Caci in September 2018, and they welcomed their son, Luke, in September 2021. The Canadian now promotes self-love and motherhood and shares business tips on social media. 08 of 08 Anna Maria Perez de Tagle as Ella Pador Anna Maria Perez De Tagle in Camp Rock and in 2023. John Medland/Disney Channel via Getty; Michael Bezjian/Getty Disney Channel fans may recognize Anna Maria Perez de Tagle not only from Camp Rock but also Hannah Montana (2006-2011). In the series, she portrayed Ashley Dewitt, a typical diva who hated Miley Stewart (played by Miley Cyrus) but ironically loved Hannah Montana. The actress went on to guest-star on Baby Daddy (2013) and Charmed (2018). In 2011, she starred in the Broadway revival of Godspell. Perez de Tagle married Scott Kline Jr. in 2019, and they welcomed their daughter, Amelia Grace, in 2021. Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Movies Children & Family Movies Close

Jonas Brothers Kick Off Tour in Hometown N.J. Show Filled with Surprise Guests and Appearances from 2 Jonas Daughters JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour began on Aug. 10 at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey By Alexandra Schonfeld Alexandra Schonfeld Alexandra Schonfeld is a features writer at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since April 2022. Her work previously appeared in Newsweek. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on August 11, 2025 05:45PM EDT Leave a Comment Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas kick off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour at MetLife Stadium on Aug. 10, 2025. Credit : Kevin Mazur/Getty NEED TO KNOW The Jonas Brothers kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour on Aug. 10 at MetLife Stadium in New JerseyThey were joined by an array of surprise guests including Jesse McCartney and Demi LovatoTo cap off the show, Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas were joined by their entire family on stage to perform "When You Look Me in the Eyes" The Jonas Brothers are on the road again. Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour on Aug. 10 at MetLife Stadium in New Jersey. The show began with a set from the All-American Rejects, who are joining the brothers for various dates and who played a set filled with all their biggest hits, including “Dirty Little Secret” and “Gives You Hell.” When it was time for the Jonas Brothers to hit the stage, they did so in front of a set that paid tribute to the George Washington Bridge and the Lincoln and Holland Tunnels. As Nick, 32, explained later in the show, the landmarks called back to their early days as a band and their many trips back and forth between New York City and their native New Jersey. Nick Jonas and Jon Foreman of Switchfoot in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Aug. 10, 2025. Kevin Mazur/Getty In a departure from their last tour, which opened with “Celebrate!” from 2023's The Album, JONAS20 kicked off on a more nostalgic note with “Lovebug,” off their 2008 album A Little Bit Longer. The band then jumped into “Love Me to Heaven” the first single off their latest record Greetings From Your Hometown, which dropped on Aug. 8. In line with the theme of the evening, all three brothers paid tribute to their home state through their first wardrobe choices, with Nick sporting a Wyckoff, N.J. varsity-style jacket, Joe, 35, rocking a studded jean jacket with the words “Mom’s favorite” and “New Jersey USA” on the back and Kevin, 37, who still lives in the Garden State, wearing a Jersey-themed patched jacket. Jesse McCartney and the Jonas Brothers perform at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Aug. 10, 2025. Kevin Mazur/Getty As promised, the band had several big surprises in store for opening night. The first came along when Switchfoot, who the brothers credit with being one of their earliest inspirations, joined them on stage to perform “Meant to Live," off Switchfoot's 2003 album The Beautiful Letdown. The bands later sang “Hold On,” which the Jonas Brothers have said was inspired by Switchfoot. Our new app is here! Free, fun and full of exclusives. Scan to download now! Later, the Jonas Brothers welcomed Jesse McCartney to the stage to perform “Beautiful Soul” after explaining that they had toured with him nearly 20 years ago at the start of their career. About an hour into their set, the trio stepped off stage for Marshmello — who along with All-American Rejects and Boys Like Girls — is slated to perform on the tour in various cities. The DJ went through a setlist of some of his biggest hits, turning MetLife Stadium into a club on a Sunday night. Nick Jonas and Marshmello in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Aug. 10, 2025. Kevin Mazur/Getty To close out his set, the Jonas Brothers returned to the stage and Marshmello grabbed a guitar to perform their collaboration “Leave Before You Love Me.” The special guests kept coming, and they later welcomed Dean Lewis, who is featured on their new album, to the stage to perform their song “Loved You Better” together. Related Stories Exes Demi Lovato and Joe Jonas Reunite for 'Camp Rock' Performance as The Jonas Brothers Kick Off 20th Anniversary Tour The Jonas Brothers' 20th Anniversary Tour Setlist Includes Their Solo Work and 'Pee Breaks' As the band continued to look back at their 20 years together, they also revisited some of Nick and Joe’s solo music through what they called a “Versus Megamix,” which saw the two brothers take turns performing some of their biggest songs from their respective Nick Jonas and the Administration and DNCE eras. The Jonas Brothers perform with Demi Lovato at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey on Aug. 10, 2025. Kevin Mazur/Getty One of the biggest surprises of the night, however, came toward the end of the show, when the trio began reflecting on their early days with Disney, particularly their involvement in the Camp Rock movies. After Joe, who played pop star Shane Gray in the film, sang "Gotta Find You,” he welcomed his former costar Demi Lovato to the stage to sing “This Is Me.” The two, who played onscreen love interests in the film and also enjoyed a short-lived relationship in real life, then sang their iconic duet "Wouldn't Change a Thing.” Around 11 p.m., as the concert was coming to an end, the brothers welcomed their entire immediate family to the stage, including youngest brother Franklin Jonas, mom Denise Jonas and dad Kevin Jonas Sr. to perform 2007’s “When You Look Me in the Eyes.” Later in the song, Kevin’s wife Danielle Jonas walked out on stage with the couple’s daughters Valentina, 8, and Alena, 11, who joined Kevin Sr. at the piano. Aug. 10 marked the first night of the tour that will take them across the country through November. For fans who don’t have tickets to see the show in person, Samsung TV Plus will be broadcasting four more tour dates on the streamer’s brand-new Samsung Television Network (STN). Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Music Pop Music

Joe Jonas Reveals Why the Jonas Brothers' Upcoming Tour Will Be 'Different' from Their Others (Exclusive) "I'm really excited," Joe tells PEOPLE of hitting the road again with his siblings Nick and Kevin as their band celebrates 20 years By Erin Clack Erin Clack Erin Clack is a Staff Editor for PEOPLE. She has been writing about fashion, parenting and pop culture for more than 15 years. People Editorial Guidelines and Hedy Phillips Hedy Phillips Hedy Phillips is the Senior Style News Editor at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2022. Her work has previously appeared in POPSUGAR, HelloGiggles, Reader's Digest and more. People Editorial Guidelines Published on June 22, 2025 08:00AM EDT Leave a Comment Joe Jonas in 2025; Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas in 2022. Credit : Jamie McCarthy/Getty; Richard Rodriguez/Getty NEED TO KNOW Joe Jonas told PEOPLE why the Jonas Brothers' upcoming tour will be “different” from their previous toursHe and siblings Nick and Kevin Jonas will kick off the Jonas20: Greetings from Your Hometown Tour on Aug. 10 in New JerseyThe tour marks the band's 20th anniversary and is tied to their seventh studio album, Greetings from Your Hometown Joe Jonas is teasing something big! The 35-year-old musician told PEOPLE in an exclusive interview that the Jonas Brothers' upcoming tour will deliver something completely "different" for fans than the band's past tours. Joe and siblings Nick Jonas and Kevin Jonas are set to kick off the Jonas20: Greetings from Your Hometown Tour on Aug. 10 at MetLife Stadium in their home state of New Jersey. "I think what fans can expect is that we are going to do what we can to give them the best show they can possibly enjoy every night. Really have a fun time on the road, enjoy the fact that we get to do this after all these years and just try to bring something different," Joe tells PEOPLE of the tour, which celebrates the group's 20th anniversary. The tour, which runs until November, will also be in support of the Jonas Brothers' upcoming seventh studio album, Greetings from Your Hometown, out on Aug. 8. Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas on Sept. 24, 2024. Francesco Prandoni/Getty "We did a big tour last year or two years ago, it bled into the last year, but I think what we’ve really realized is that we wanted to bring a show for the audience that they felt like was something different from what they’ve experienced before," he continues, noting that the plan was to give fans a chance to offer input. "We’re going to build a show with our audience, so we’re rehearsing pretty much onstage and playing some of these older songs that we haven’t played in so many years and see how they respond and what they want to hear," he explains. As the setlist is still taking shape, Joe — who serves as an ambassador for Scotch & Soda and has a collaboration collection with the fashion brand — says he and his brothers are also still ironing out their onstage wardrobes for a tour that will get underway in the heat of summer, just after they perform in New York City for the 4th of July fireworks with Macy's. "We’re in the middle of figuring out what we’re going to wear, but we never really dress according to the weather. The stadiums outside, it’s like you don’t even... I think it’s going to be important because we’re going to be sweating through those outfits really fast," Joe tells PEOPLE. "Not much leather — there won’t be a lot of leather being worn," he predicts. "I mean, you know, fashion can hurt, but that's one choice that we will avoid." Related Stories JONASCON Is Hitting the Road — See If the Jonas Brothers Fan Experience Is Coming to a City Near You (Exclusive) Kevin Jonas Teases New Jonas Brothers Tour Details and Reveals His Favorite Song on the New Album (Exclusive) Reflecting on the 20-year milestone, Joe says it's a privilege and a thrill to still be doing what he loves, two decades later. "Twenty years in now, still being able to do what we love for a living and have so many supportive fans and people that show up for these shows and listen to our new music and stuff, it’s why it keeps us doing what we do," he explains. "I wake up every morning, [and] I’m ready. I get to do what I love for a living, so I’m happy to keep it going." Nick, Joe and Kevin Jonas on April 16, 2024. Mauricio Santana/Getty Kevin, 37, also opened up about the emotional milestone in a separate exclusive interview with PEOPLE in May. Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. “It’s just wild to think that we've been a part of people's lives for this long, but I think what's really cool is that it's still continuing to be new," he said at the time, promising a tour setlist that will mix both oldies and top hits. "We're constantly talking about the setlist, which is always a thing for us,” Kevin noted. “We've been building out the show conceptually and what we wanted it to feel and look like. It's gonna be really special. You know, it's 20 years of the band, but really it's just about us going back on the road to celebrate how many people have been with us for so long, and the fans that have been made this journey possible.” Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Music Pop Music

Why Nick Jonas Thinks the Jonas Brothers' Catalog 'Aged Very Well' Ahead of Tour Marking 20th Anniversary (Exclusive) The Jonas Brothers and Mastercard are teaming up in support of Stand Up To Cancer By Marina Watts Marina Watts Marina Watts is a Digital Writer, Music at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2024. Her work has previously appeared on Bustle, The US Sun, Newsweek and OK! Magazine. People Editorial Guidelines Published on July 15, 2025 11:10AM EDT Leave a Comment NEED TO KNOW Nick Jonas tells PEOPLE why he thinks the Jonas Brothers' catalog has "aged very well"The band is teaming up with Mastercard to support Stand Up to CancerThe Jonas Brothers kick off their 20th anniversary tour in support of upcoming album Greetings from Your Hometown this summer The Jonas Brothers' catalog is only getting better as time goes by. Speaking exclusively with PEOPLE in partnership with Mastercard in support of Stand Up to Cancer, Nick Jonas reflects on how their fanbase has changed over time as they gear up for their 20th anniversary tour in support of their upcoming album, Greetings from Your Hometown. "It's aged very well. It's one of those things where we've looked out and seen the fan base really evolve and change and there's sort of a generational aspect to it now when you think about it," Nick, 32, says. "The people that were our age back when we were teens touring and making music are our age now and they've grown up and they're bringing their kids to the shows, but their parents that brought them when they were in their youth still want to come." Mastercard and Jonas Brothers to debut music video in support of Stand Up To Cancer. Katie Henry Courtesy of Mastercard Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Nick adds that there's a "really interesting group of people" who attend the JoBro concerts and "respond to different parts of the catalog," ranging from longtime fans to newer fans who are more familiar with Happiness Begins or The Album. "It's great to look out there and see such a really interesting mix and to see that the songs they respond to are a reflection of that," Nick says. Related Stories Joe Jonas Reveals Why the Jonas Brothers' Upcoming Tour Will Be 'Different' from Their Others (Exclusive) Jonas Brothers Perform 'Camp Rock' Song, Cover The Cranberries for 'Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve with Ryan Seacrest' Mastercard and the Jonas Brothers, which also includes Joe Jonas and Kevin Jonas, are honoring the inspiring ways people stand up to cancer every day. Mastercard surprised JoBros superfans and their loved ones impacted by cancer with a once-in-a-lifetime experience. What began as an invitation for these superfans to share their stories turned into a special moment of connection and celebration. The band performed their new song "I Can't Lose," from their upcoming album, in New York, just for them. Their moving stories and reactions were captured for the "I Can't Lose" music video, which premieres during the 2025 MLB All-Star Game on July 15. The PEOPLE Puzzler crossword is here! How quickly can you solve it? Play now! "We've been lucky enough to meet some incredible fans over the years and this partnership with Mastercard really has been wonderful for us to spend some time with some of our fans who've been affected by cancer," Joe, 35, tells PEOPLE about their latest endeavor. Mastercard and Jonas Brothers to debut music video in support of Stand Up To Cancer. Katie Henry Courtesy of Mastercard "It was really nice to spend time and get to know them a bit more and hear their stories and just to be a part of their journey in some capacity or a distraction musically to help them through a little bit of what they're going through," he adds. "It was just kind of mind-blowing to us and is a reminder of why we do what we do." Mastercard and Jonas Brothers to debut music video in support of Stand Up To Cancer. Katie Henry Courtesy of Mastercard Nick says their new song, "I Can't Lose," focuses on "spreading a message of hope." "The verses talk about pretty much everything during the day not going your way. And the chorus becomes an anthem to persevere. And I think the sentiment alongside Mastercard and Stand Up to Cancer just made perfect sense." "Anytime we can be a very small part of someone's journey through tough times in life, we're really grateful for that. And writing and recording songs like this that speak to that message of hope is really important to us," adds Nick. Through Aug. 22, Mastercard will donate one cent, up to $5 million, to Stand Up to Cancer when cardholders use their Mastercard at qualifying restaurants and grocery stores. The "I Can't Lose" music video will premiere on Tuesday, July 15, during the 2025 MLB All-Star Game Presented by Mastercard on FOX, following the placard moment. Greetings from Your Hometown, out on Aug. 8, is available for pre-order. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Music Pop Music

'Tina — The Tina Turner Musical' Team React to Singer's Death: Her 'Legacy Lives On' Tina Turner died Wednesday after a long illness at her home in Switzerland, her publicist confirmed Wednesday By Tommy McArdle Tommy McArdle Tommy McArdle is a writer-reporter on the Movies team at PEOPLE. Tommy joined PEOPLE in 2022. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on May 24, 2023 05:38PM EDT The team behind the hit Broadway musical based on Tina Turner's life and career are mourning the late singer and musician after her death at age 83. Following news of Turner's death Wednesday, the official Instagram account for Tina — The Tina Turner Musical shared a statement noting that her "legacy lives on in so many beautiful ways as we mourn a legendary woman." "Tina Turner’s contribution as an iconic music artist and performer, her influence on fellow artists and her inspiration to generations who followed her, is legendary," the statement reads, alongside a portrait of Turner. "Through her life story and her music, Tina Turner inspired and taught so many people around the world to find strength from within," the statement continues. "This is a loss that will be deeply felt. Words can’t express our feelings, so we look to one another to share the love, respect andkindness that she shared with us." Bruce Glikas/WireImage, Pete Still/Redferns The musical, which remains in production on tour following its closing date on Broadway back in August, received 12 nominations at the 74th Tony Awards. Adrienne Warren, who originated the musical's lead role as Turner in its West End inception and original Broadway run, won best actress in a musical at the show, Tina Turner's Life in Photos A statement on the production's official website shares that performances of the musical "will continue as planned" after the icon's death. The touring musical is currently in production at the Eccles Center Salt Lake City through June 4, with performances planned around the country until Aug. 4, 2024. "Our love, thoughts, and prayers are with Erwin Bach and Tina’s family," the production added in its statement on Instagram Wednesday. "TINA: The Tina Turner Musical is a true celebration of this exceptional woman, and in our mourning we continue to celebrate her life, her talent and her joy." Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Turner died Wednesday, May 24 after a long illness at her home near Zürich in Switzerland, her publicist Bernard Doherty confirmed in a statement. Tina Turner and Adrienne Warren in 2019. Walter McBride/WireImage Angela Bassett Says She Wasn't 'Robbed' of an Oscar for Playing Tina Turner: 'Too Negative of an Emotion' "With her, the world loses a music legend and a role model," the statement read. "There will be a private funeral ceremony attended by close friends and family. Please respect the privacy of her family at this difficult time." Turner, who had lived in Switzerland since 1994 with her husband Erwin Bach, had battled a number of serious health problems in the years prior to her death, including a stroke, intestinal cancer and total kidney failure that required an organ transplant. She earned her Swiss citizenship in 2013. Read more: Celebrity Celebrity Deaths Celebrity Death News

argos_summary: During a recent episode of a hot wing eating challenge, Kevin Jonas reflected on his brother Nick's intense work ethic as a child, recalling how Nick chose to stay home and work on Broadway instead of joining the family on a cruise. The Jonas Brothers kicked off their JONAS20: Greetings From Your Hometown Tour on August 10, 2025, in New Jersey, featuring surprise performances by Demi Lovato and Jesse McCartney, among others. The tour celebrates the band's 20th anniversary and their latest album, 'Greetings from Your Hometown,' showcasing their evolving fan base and musical legacy.
